definition[0]: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true
example[0]: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so, ’ Charles conceded.
example[1]: I conceded that I had made a number of errors.
definition[1]: to admit that you are not going to win a game, argument, battle etc
example[2]: The Georgian forces defended the capital but were finally obliged to concede.
example[3]: In May 1949, Stalin conceded defeat and reopened land access to Berlin.
definition[2]: to give something to someone as a right or privilege, often unwillingly
example[4]: The King finally agreed to concede further powers to Parliament.
example[5]: Finally the company conceded wage increases to their workers.
